case_data.name: Urban Justice Center Safety Net Project v. City of New York
case_data.plaintiff_description: Homeless New Yorkers who have been subjected to numerous homeless sweeps and are at imminent risk of being subjected to additional homeless sweeps in the immediate future.
case_data.summary:
This is a case alleging that New York City’s “homeless sweeps” violate the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments to the United States Constitution. On October 29, 2024, a group of homeless individuals in New York City and the Urban Justice Safety Net Project filed a class action complaint challenging the City’s use of sweeps, also referred to as cleanups, against homeless individuals. The plaintiffs were homeless New Yorkers who have been subjected to homeless sweeps and are at imminent risk of being subjected to homeless sweeps in the immediate future. The plaintiffs allege that the sweeps operations do not connect homeless New Yorkers with important social services and that the city’s conduct at sweeps is not rationally connected to its stated goals of clearing structures and addressing sanitation conditions. The plaintiffs argued that the City’s homeless sweeps have violated the Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments to the United States Constitution, as well as Article XVII of the New York State Constitution, and the laws of the City and State of New York. 

The lawsuit sought to certify as a class action case for two categories. First, the Property Class: Every homeless person who has had and/or will have their personal belongings seized and/or destroyed by the City of New York during a cleanup of a homeless hotspot, popup, or encampment. Second, the Forced Relocation Class: Every homeless person who has been and/or will be forced to leave the place where they reside by the City of New York due to the City’s policy and practice regarding a cleanup of a homeless hotspot, popup, or encampment.

On October 30, 2024, the case was assigned to Judge John G. Koeltl. On the same day, Magistrate Judge Katharine H. Parker was also assigned to the case.

As of November 24, 2024, this case is ongoing.
